oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Orchard testing of new, alternative fungicides against apple scab
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lindhard Pedersen, Hanne
Paaske, Klaus
Bengtsson, Marianne V.
Hockenhull, John
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Apple scab, caused by the fungus Venturia inaequalis, is the disease that most often decreases yield and causes loss of fruit quality in organic apple production. Damage to the fruits consists of brown to black spots, but in some years and on some varieties attacks can result in small misshapen fruits, that are totally unsuitable for fresh consumption.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Lindhard Pedersen, Hanne; Paaske, Klaus; Bengtsson, Marianne V. and Hockenhull, John (2004) Orchard testing of new, alternative fungicides against apple scab. DARCOFenews (2), pp. 1-2.
